metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23514 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Loofah is a general library for manipulating and transforming HTML/XML documents and fragments, built on top of Nokogiri. Loofah < 2.19.1 contains an inefficient regular expression that is susceptible to excessive backtracking when attempting to sanitize certain SVG attributes. This may lead to a denial of service through CPU resource consumption. This issue is patched in version 2.19.1.

criterions.comment: ruby-loofah: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
